meanings.sent1: We arrived early presummit to ensure we had enough time to prepare.
meanings.sent2: The leaders met presummit to discuss the agenda for the upcoming summit.
meanings.sent3: The team decided to have a presummit breakfast to go over their strategy.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the air presummit was palpable, signaling the importance of the upcoming meeting.
meanings.sent5: The birds chirped happily presummit, unaware of the high-stakes discussions about to take place.

meanings.definition: To assume or take for granted.
meanings.sent1: I presummit that you will be attending the event with us.
meanings.sent2: Do not presummit that everyone will agree with your point of view.
meanings.sent3: She presummitted that her package would arrive on time, but it got delayed.
meanings.sent4: Let's not presummit success before we have put in the necessary effort.
meanings.sent5: He presummitted the answer to the riddle, only to realize he was completely wrong.
